His recipe includes a hibiscus-ginger simple syrup and a lime garnish–a nostalgic combination that will make you feel like you're on vacation.By BOMBAY SAPPHIRE® GINDecember 11, 20205.0(4)Read ReviewsTriangleEmailPinterestPrintTed + Chelsea CavanaughEmailPinterestPrintEmailPinterestPrintIngredients1½oz. Bombay Sapphire4oz. premium tonic water, to top1piece of ginger about 1 ½-in., thinly sliced1cup sugar1cup dried hibiscus flowers1cup water½oz. fresh lime juice plus thinly sliced rounds, for garnishIcePreparationStep 1Combine sugar, hibiscus, ginger, and 1 cup water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a simmer (do not boil) over medium-high, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat. Let steep 20 minutes until flavorful and bright.Step 2Set a fine sieve over a medium heatproof bowl. Strain the mixture into the bowl; discard solids. Refrigerate hibiscus-ginger syrup until chilled, at least 30 minutes.Step 3Fill the glass with ice. Pour in the Bombay Sapphire, 1 oz. of the hibiscus-ginger syrup, lime juice, and tonic water. Gently stir. Garnish with 1-2 thinly sliced lime rounds.Click to Shop Bombay Sapphire NowBE BRILLIANT AND INSPIRED. DRINK RESPONSIBLY!©2020.
